spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.camera.camera.documentation: Total camera dimension in each direction (horizontal, vertical)
Index in the error_description list for "camera_dimensions"

Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.camera.pixel_.documentation: Pixel dimension in each direction (horizontal, vertical)
Index in the error_description list for "pixel_dimensions"
Number of pixels in each direction (horizontal, vertical)

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.camera.x3_uni.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the camera plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.code.library[.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.code.output_f.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.code.paramete.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.crystal.angle.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "angle_bragg"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.crystal.angul.documentation: Angular span in the horizontal direction, to be filled only for geometry_type/index = 2, 3 or 4
Index in the error_description list for "angular_span_horizontal"
Angular span in the vertical direction, to be filled only for geometry_type/index = 4
Index in the error_description list for "angular_span_vertical"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.crystal.curva.documentation: Radius of curvature in the horizontal direction, to be filled only for shape/index = 2, 3 or 4
Index in the error_description list for "curvature_horizontal"
Radius of curvature in the vertical direction, to be filled only for geometry_type/index = 4
Index in the error_description list for "curvature_vertical"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.crystal.geome.documentation:
Geometry of the crystal
1) planar : Planar
2) cylindrical : Cylindrical
3) spherical : Spherical
4) elliptical : Elliptical
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.ids_propertie.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS
Any comment describing the content of this IDS
Date at which this data has been produced

This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.ids_propertie.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.ids_propertie.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data
Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)
Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.integration_t.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "integration_time"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.latency_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "latency"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.t_e_proxy.documentation: Electron temperature (proxy estimated directly from the camera, without tomographic inversion)

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.t_e_proxy.dat.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.t_e_proxy.val.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.t_i_proxy.documentation: Ion temperature (proxy estimated directly from the camera, without tomographic inversion)

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.t_i_proxy.dat.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.t_i_proxy.val.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

Index in the error_description list for "data"

Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.wavelength_fr.documentation: Wavelength of incoming photons on each pixel of the frames, mainly varying accross the horizontal dimension of the frame. However a 2D map of the wavelength is given since it is not constant vertically due to the elliptical curvature of the photon iso-surfaces
Index in the error_description list for "wavelength_frames"

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.z_frames.documentation: Height of the observed zone at the focal plane in the plasma, corresponding to the vertical dimension of the frame

spectrometer_x_ray_crystal.z_frames_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_frames"
